questions.text: Femoral hernia in Nyhus classification:

A 22-year-old Caucasion male presents to general surgery clinic or evaluation and treatment of a left inguinal hernia. During the physical examination, the hernia is identifed, but a 3 cm left testicular mass is also noted. It is painless and firm. The patient has not noted it previously. What is the primary landing zone or retro- peritoneal metastases in a left -sided testicular germ cell tumor?

A 25-year-old male presents to the emergency department with severe epigastric pain and mild elevations in lipase (3 x ULN) diagnostic of acute pancreatitis. The patient describes multiple episodes of pain and associated pancreas enzyme elevations since early childhood that generally respond to brief hospitalizations and conservative treatment including intravenous fluids and IV analgesics. CT imaging reveals parenchymal calcifications seen throughout the pancreas. Further history discloses two relatives with similar pain attacks. Which of the following gene mutations is most likely to be associated with the cause of the recurrent pancreatitis in this patient?

A 54-year-old alcoholic male with a history of recurrent acute pancreatitis undergoes a CT scan for abdominal pain that reveals pancreatic parenchymal calcifications and a dilated main pancreatic duct of 11 mm. There is no evidence of a pancreatic mass or evidence of duodenal obstructive symptoms. What is the best long term management of pain in this patient with chronic pancreatitis?

A 35-year-old trauma victim with malabsorption requires nutritional support. The patient’s injuries include a stable nondisplaced fracture of the third thoracic vertebra, a closed head injury, multiple upper and lower extremity fractures, and bilateral pulmonary contusions requiring ventilatory support. Which of the following are the most appropriate site and type of venous access for TPN in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral antecubital fossa, 18-gauge peripheral intravenous catheters

options.label: C
options.text: Dorsum of one foot, 16-gauge peripheral intrave-nous catheter

questions.correct_answer: D. Subclavian vein, central venous catheter

questions.text: Regarding the given Figure which one of the following state- ments is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibroblasts have increased sensitivity to TGF-β1.

options.label: B
options.text: Tension during closure is a contributory factor.

options.label: C
options.text: Scar parallel to the underlying muscle may prevent this condition.

options.label: D
options.text: Infection is a common cause for this condition.

questions.correct_answer: A. Fibroblasts have increased sensitivity to TGF-β1.

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl arrives to the emergency department with complaints of nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain for the past day. She has no significant past medical history, but her mother reports that she was involved in a motor vehicle accident about a month ago. She was restrained in a car seat and had blunt trauma to her abdomen. She had no com- plaints at the time. Her vital signs were normal, and she was subsequently discharged a few hours later. Her blood pressure is currently 112/82 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, and respiratory rate is 28/min. Her chest x-ray is shown above (. Fig. ). What is the most likely diagnosis?
When should parenteral antibiotics be given perioperatively?
A 65-year-old woman is found to have microscopic hematuria on a urinalysis done for a work physical. A follow-up cystoscopy shows a low-grade Ta bladder tumor. What is the appropriate treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Observation with urine cytology every 6 months

questions.correct_answer: D. TURBT followed by intravesical mitomycin

questions.text: A 5-week-old boy presents with a 6-day history of vomiting. The parents report that his vomiting is more forceful than his usual spit ups and contain significantly more volume. The mother describes the vomit as partially digested milk. Between episodes of vomiting, the baby feeds vigorously. The parents report that he has made only one wet diaper today. On physical exam, the baby appears lethargic. Mucous membranes are dry, and the anterior fontanelle is open and sunken. Capillary refill is 2 s. The growth chart reveals a 0.5-lb weight loss since his clinic visit 7 days ago. What is the next step in management?

A 45-year-old man has had hazy vision for the past month, particularly when he is driving at night. He also endorses small rubberlike nodules on the skin of his trunk, back, arms, and legs that are not painful and do not itch. After seeing his ophthalmologist, he is diagnosed with bilateral cataracts and is scheduled to receive elective cataract surgery. During induction of anesthesia, following intubation, the patient’s pressure increases from 110/70 to 200/90 mmHg. PaCO2 is normal as is his pH. His temperature is 38.4 °F. An esmolol drip is immediately instituted, after which BP increases to 220/90 mmHg and an electrocardiogram shows T-wave inversion. What is the most likely underlying etiology?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the emergency department at 1 am with a 3-hour history of pain in his right testicle. He denies any trauma but does a lot of long distance running. Examination is difficult due to pain; however the right testicle does appear to be swollen, slightly red and extremely tender. Which of the following do you do next?

options.label: A
options.text: Admit for urgent ultrasound scan the next morning

options.label: B
options.text: Contact the urologist on call and organize urgent ultrasound scan

options.label: C
options.text: Shift to OT for emergency surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Prescribe strong analgesia and advise to stop running till symptoms resolve

questions.correct_answer: C. Shift to OT for emergency surgery

questions.text: A 45-year-old fmale presents with a 3 cm painless mass in her right anterior neck that has been present for 3 months and slowly enlarging(fig). On physical exam, the mass feels firm and moves up and down with swallowing. he denies weight loss, weight gain, heat intolerance, or anxiety. A serum thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) level is normal. The most important step in the workup is:
Which of the following is true regarding laparoscopic inguinal hernia repair?

options.label: A
options.text: It is generally less expensive than the open repair.

options.label: B
options.text: Potential complications are similar, or less severe,to those seen with open repair.

options.label: C
options.text: Procedure is limited to the repair of only one defect in the inguinal region given poor visualization of the-anatomy.

options.label: D
options.text: It is usually the favored approach in special situations such as in recurrent or bilateral inguinal hernias.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is usually the favored approach in special situations such as in recurrent or bilateral inguinal hernias.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a 3-hour history of left loin pain radiating to the left groin. He is known to have benign prostatic hypertrophy and recurrent urinary tract infections. The intravenous urogram (IVU) shows a standing column on the left. Which of the following types of stone is most likely to have caused his symptoms?

A 57-year-old, otherwise healthy female presents to your clinic to discuss the results of her recent screening mammogram. She has previously had unremarkable screening mammograms since the age of 40. She has two aunts with breast cancer, and recently heard that her 35-year-old niece was diagnosed with invasive ductal adenocarcinoma. She reports no palpable masses noticed on breast self exams, no nipple drainage, no breast skin changes, and no other concerning constitutional symptoms. 1. The patient requests counseling on various genetic syndromes, given the young age of her recently diagnosed niece. Which of the following is correctly matched?

options.label: A
options.text: BRCA1—chromosome 13q—increased female and male breast cancer risk.

options.label: B
options.text: BRCA1—chromosome 17q—increased female breast and ovarian cancer risk.

options.label: C
options.text: BRCA2—chromosome 17q—increased female and male breast cancer risk.

options.label: D
options.text: Li-Fraumeni syndrome—PTEN mutation— increased breast, nervous system, and GI tract cancers.

questions.correct_answer: B. BRCA1—chromosome 17q—increased female breast and ovarian cancer risk.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true in ulcerative colitis (UC)?

options.label: A
options.text: In 95% of cases, the disease starts in the rectum and spreads proximally.

options.label: B
options.text: Granulomas are a typical microscopic feature.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a diffuse disease affecting all the layers of the large bowel.

options.label: D
options.text: Involvement of ileum and jejunum is frequent in most cases.

questions.correct_answer: A. In 95% of cases, the disease starts in the rectum and spreads proximally.

questions.text: Which of the following statement is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: The current favoured technique of bowel anastomosis is the one-layer extramucosal interrupted method.

options.label: B
options.text: The bowel must be prepared prior to any anastomosis.

options.label: C
options.text: It is essential that in end-to-end anastomosis the bowel ends should match the diameter.

options.label: D
options.text: In vascular anastomosis, polypropylene is the suture material to be used.

questions.correct_answer: B. The bowel must be prepared prior to any anastomosis.

questions.text: Which of the following are indications for radioiodine treatment?

If the Veress needle has been unintentionally placed in the iliac artery during creation of the pneumoperitoneum for insufflation of the abdomen, which of the following is the best course of action to minimize further patient injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Remove the Veress needle, and proceed to open the abdomen.

options.label: B
options.text: Remove the Veress needle, and then proceed with insufflating at a different location.

options.label: C
options.text: Leave the Veress needle in place, and open the abdomen.

options.label: D
options.text: Leave the Veress needle in place, and proceed with insufflation of the abdomen at a different location.

questions.correct_answer: D. Leave the Veress needle in place, and proceed with insufflation of the abdomen at a different location.

questions.text: A 55-year-old previously healthy male is postoperative day 2 status post left hemicolectomy for Dukes B colon cancer. He is slow to regain mobility due to complaints of pain. All of the following are accepted treatment options for DVT prophylaxis except
